bibl.title: Nominal Accidents by Question and Answer: Two Fragments of a T°xnh grammatikÆ, One New. <techne grammatike>
bibl.note: Two fragments from a papyrus roll containing a t°xnh grammatikÆ. Provenance unknown, late first or early second century. - P.S.I. Inv. 505, fr. B (= Pack2 2152) was re-edited by: Alfons WOUTERS, The Grammatical Papyri from Graeco-Roman Egypt. Contributions to the Study of the "Ars grammatica" in Antiquity = Verhandelingen van de koninklijke Academie voor Wetenschappen, Letteren en Schone Kunsten van België. Klasse der Letteren. Jaargang 41, Nr. 92 (Brussel, 1979) pp. 135-138, Nr. 7.; fr. A is new. Reconstruction of the whole text, translation and commentary. <techne grammatike>
LUNDON John and Stephanos MATTHAIOS, Nominal Accidents by Question and Answer: Two Fragments of a T°xnh grammatikÆ, One New. <techne grammatike>
